answerText: Zambezi River [10] The Zambian town of Livingstone lies across the border from this waterfall across the Zambezi which is almost two kilometers wide and drops about 350 feet at its deepest.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Seven Lakes/Rockefeller  | 9 | Geography | None | College
subject: Geography
question: Question: This river's course contains the Kariba and Cahora Bassa dams. For 10 points each: [10] Name this river of southern Africa whose Kafue and Luangwa tributaries run through Zambia.
